item.title: To urge the resolution of claims related to the confiscation of certain property by the Government of Italy.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

item.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (text: CR S6680-6681)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(text: CR S6680-6681)
Senate Committee on Foreign Relations discharged by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6680-6681)
Senate Committee on Foreign Relations discharged by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S6680-6681)
Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S4161)

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Senate that: (1) the Government of Italy should fulfill the requirements of the Treaty of Friendship, Commerce and Navigation between the United States and the Italian Republic with respect to the property of Mr. Pier Talenti that was confiscated by Italy, and make reasonable efforts to resolve Mr. Talenti's claims; and (2) the Secretary of State should continue to press the Government of Italy to resolve Mr. Talenti's claims, and take any further measures that could assist Mr. Talenti in receiving such compensation.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Expresses the sense of the Senate that: (1) the Government of Italy should fulfill the requirements of the Treaty of Friendship, Commerce and Navigation between the United States and the Italian Republic with respect to the property of Mr. Pier Talenti that was confiscated by Italy and make reasonable efforts to resolve Mr. Talenti's claims; and (2) the Secretary of State should continue to press the Government of Italy to resolve Mr. Talenti's claims and take any further measures that could assist Mr. Talenti in receiving such compensation.

bill.title: A resolution to urge the resolution of claims related to the confiscation of certain property by the Government of Italy.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
